summary: This is an internal FBI email chain forwarding a meeting cancellation notice for the CID UC Weekly Meeting. It shows the extensive distribution list of FBI personnel involved in the Criminal Investigative Division (CID), indicating the scale of the investigative effort related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Watson, Sean P.
persons.context: Primary recipient of the forwarded email regarding the CID UC Weekly Meeting cancellation.

persons.name: DeJesus-Treskow, Daniela
persons.context: Sender of the original meeting cancellation email on behalf of Robert Johnson.

persons.name: Johnson, Robert
persons.context: Person on whose behalf the meeting cancellation email was sent; likely the meeting organizer.

persons.context: Recipient of the original CID UC Weekly Meeting cancellation email.

persons.name: Shivers, Calvin A.
persons.context: Recipient of the original CID UC Weekly Meeting cancellation email.

events.title: CID UC Weekly Meeting Cancellation
events.description: The regularly scheduled CID UC Weekly Meeting for Wednesday at 2:00 p.m. is canceled, as notified via email.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email dated February 11, 2019, regarding the cancellation of a weekly meeting for the Criminal Investigative Division (CID).
It contains an extensive distribution list of over 70 FBI personnel, indicating a large, coordinated investigative effort within CID.
The meeting was to be held via Skype/secure phone bridge, highlighting the use of secure communication protocols within the FBI.
The document itself is classified as UNCLASSIFIED.
The email is part of the Epstein case document set (EFTA00148007), suggesting the CID's UC (likely Undercover or Unit Chief) weekly meeting was related to the ongoing Epstein investigation.
